name: Natura Park Beach - EcoResort & Spa

reviews.text: One of the recommended accomodation in Punta Cana is the NATURA PARK ECO-RESORT & SPA which is lauded for its environmentally friendly design amongst other things. I hate to be the bearer of bad news but not only is NATURA PARK not the model environmentally aware corporate citizen, but its services are absolutely horrendous. First off, the reusable beach cups are gone; second off, bleach-free laundy was a marketing stunt and no longer applies as well. Thirdly, the service was bad. This especially holds true for front desk personnel who had the audacity to insult some members of my travelling party. Finally, a word of advice to those booking NATURA independantly outside a tour group ... DONT! We had confirmed pre-paid booking for 8 persons for 3 nights and they were given to tour groups and airline personnel with big contracts. As an independant traveller, I would avoid Natura Park because you never know if your reservation would be there. (Oh, we had confirmed our reservation 4 times via email and called 3 successive days prior to arrival).
reviews.title: Not eco-frendly; and NOT recommended for non-tour group reservations
Great Time
reviews.text: Cheers.

reviews.title: Wonderful Time
reviews.text: PS: The beach is full of sea-weed anyways :(.

reviews.title: Okay, but some problems
reviews.text: The surroundings of this resort with awesome. Immaculate conditions throughout hotel, washrooms etc. Don't ever think requesting rooms together will happen when you arrive. Learn your spanish - it pays. First time parasailing - fantastic (Pedro and helper) were the best (Highly recommend it) and I was so frightened. The most wonderful way to see the lagoon and coral reefs

reviews.title: Overall Great Hotel
reviews.text: Only disappointment was the hotel allowing vendors to set up on walkways to the buffets and bars, especially when our rooms was near the lobby. The entertainment staff were really good and worked a long 15 hr day.

We traveled to this resort March 1 – March 8. Unfortunately, the timing of our flight through USA 3000 had us checking into the hotel at 9:00 p.m. The check-in for us was relatively painless (although we were two couples traveling together, they had us in different buildings, but once we told them of this, they had us moved quite close together). We needed to rush to get some dinner, but other than losing all of Saturday as a travel day, things were smooth. Apple really does keep things organized.
reviews.title: We don't understand the negative reviews!

reviews.text: Our goal during this vacation was to recharge our batteries. We are all rather “low maintenance” folks, so were not expecting to be waited on hand and foot. We were terribly concerned after reading sooooooo many negative reviews and we were looking to be disappointed with some things at the resort. Let me say outright – Nearly everything negative posted by so many travelers turned out to be non-issues. We were pleased with the service, and yes, we did tip a bit (not extravagantly) and were rewarded with what appeared genuine smiles and wonderful service.
reviews.title: Nice resort beautiful grounds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I could go on and on in an attempt to rebut every negative issue posted, but suffice it to say, we not only would go back, but are already in the process of making our return arrangements for this fall.
reviews.title: Nice Place - Bad Food

reviews.text: We stayed at the Natura park from March 3rd to the 10th. Let me start by saying that this was my 4th visit to Punta Cana and I've also been to Cuba 3 times and Jamaica as well, we always stay at 3.5 to 4 star hotels.
reviews.title: Mixed Feelings!!!

reviews.text: Check in was actually fast and efficient our room was ready exactly when they said it would be.
reviews.title: Nice Resort/Bad Everything Else

reviews.text: I was at the Natura from Feb 25 - March 4 and had a wonderful time. I went with a girl friend , we left the husbands at home! Reading the different reviews I was a little hesitant about staying at the Natura but that soon changed. The Airport transfer to the hotel went smoothly as did check in, we did have trouble finding our room but the staff were very helpful. The room was clean and didn't stink the house cleaning staff made sure the room was cleaned daily. The food was pretty good ,I must say it was better then the stuff I've had in Mexico or even closer to home. We went to the steak house one evening and the Italian twice. There was a Seafood Resturant but we didn't hear many good things about that place so we just stayed away. But for the other two they were fine the steaks there are very thin but tastey.
reviews.title: A very enjoyable week at the Natura!

reviews.text: The pool restaurant during the day was great the one day they had a big BBQ and another day they had a big seafood stir fry besides all the other stuff inside. There was some very good pasta dishes. We did pack some food just in case we didn't like thier choices and never touched it and ended up leaving it for some of the staff we got to know. The staff seemed very friendly we only had trouble with one and that was the towel guy, we called him the Towel Nazi . This guy was miserable!
reviews.title: Appalling

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The entertainment was okay, no it wasn't a Las Vegas show it was a Punta Cana Show and we enjoyed all of them. The grounds of the Natura are beautiful lots of trees and tropical plants. Ponds with different animals, fish, ducks, geese, flamingo's just to name a few and bridges going over some of them it was very nice I must say.
reviews.title: We had a wonderful time.
WOW - We would go back anytime.
reviews.text: They have a nice pool area and the beach area was great you do want to get up early and put a towel on your chair they go fast. Yes there is seaweed in the water and on the beach the guys are out there daily raking the seaweed. It didn't stop me from going out for a swim. If you turn left at the beach you can go for a very long walk before you come close to any resorts. We went to Saona Island one day on an excursion which was a fun day.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall our stay at the Natura was Great and I would recommend it to any one. Unless you are the kind of person that enjoys going on holidays just to complain about everything then maybe you should just stay home. But if you're going for some fun and R&R then this is the place for you. Sure there are fancier resorts with the Casino's and maybe I'll stay at one of them next time but I really can't complain about the Natura. We had a great week in Punta Cana!
reviews.title: 3rd Time and Last

reviews.text: We just came back from an awesome time in the DR we stayed at the Natura Park in Punta Cana. We went with a group of 18, We were very nervous at first because we heard so many negative reviews for example: people said that the Ducks were mean...Not true...That there were birds and nasty droppings in their food...NOt true..We loved the animals they didn't bother us at all they just wondered around and were very entertaining to watch. It was VERY CLEAN! The grounds were beatiful very well kept.
reviews.title: AWESOME VACATION!! wonderful place to stay

likes.liked: — The grounds were very well kept.. The animals...relaxing

reviews.title: Natura Park Beach & Eco Resort, Punta Cana
reviews.text: The Food was ok ...lot's of variety so if you didn't like something there was so many more choices, we found that if you tipped the servers they treated you like royalty (a Dollar goes along way) They would bend over backwards to get you seats at the buffet they even saved our seats for our group ask for Freddie and Bruno they are so friendly and awesome servers..They made sure that we had hot coffee and anything else we needed, they were so helpful in helping us with our spanish they were very good teachers.

reviews.title: Great place to relax
reviews.text: We were looking for all those crazy speed boats that we read about in the reviews there were boats in the water but that's the ocean... they didn't get in the way it was normal.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also heard about vendors bothering you NOT TRUE!!! When you first get there they walk the beach and ask you if you want to do any activities like horseback riding.. dune buggies.. snorkling etc. But they don't bug you if you don't want to do it just say no... then they go to the next person they don't hassle you, they just want you to have a good time there and take advantage of everything that they have to offer.
reviews.title: Great Resort and a few but...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did the dune buggy's so much fun!! we loved it. Some friends of ours did the out back and they loved that..
reviews.title: I would never go back neither recommend it
I'll Be Back! ! !
reviews.text: I spent 8 days in Punta Cana, and I had the time of my life! This is the vacation spot for anyone needing R & R.

reviews.title: Beautiful and highly recommended
reviews.text: My flight on USA 3000 was comfortable, quick and a delight. (Stay away from the chicken!) A beautiful moment is being above the clouds and the sun setting.

reviews.title: We will go back!!
reviews.text: My stay at Natura Park was GREAT! The grounds are beautiful, well kept, and a place to be admired. Natura Park is a natural park setting with the animals roaming the grounds freely and enjoying a free bite, too! The rooms are simple and clean, what more can you ask for? Be careful of the mini-bar in your room, bring your own snacks.

reviews.title: ABSOLUTELY THE BEST TIME!!!
reviews.text: This vacation was with a colleague, who like I needed a rest! Our daily beach moments always left us feeling refreshed, relaxed and calm. Take time to walk the beach and absorb the fresh air you'll be glad you did! If you need more action, there's enough water sports to enjoy as well as other entertainment.

reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, beach,and people
reviews.text: The Food was AWESOME! Some people complained, but I can't imagine why. Every food taste could be accommodated. The Italian Restaurant is the best! I sincerely admire the hard work of the people of the D.R. They were friendly, helpful and kind. Although I do not speak Spanish and sometimes communication could be difficult, it was still fun!

reviews.title: Good time had by all
reviews.text: We just returned from the Natura having stayed June 28th-July 1. My husband and I went with my sister and her husband. We have stayed at several all inclusives and this one ranked right up there with the others. The grounds are beautiful and the ground keepers work very hard to maintain it. One was cutting down some fruit from a tree, I am assuming so it would not fall on someone walking by and offered it to me. The flamingos are beautiful and it was fun to see the geese laying on their eggs. The peacock was fun especially when it came right up to our table at the main buffet. The rooms were pretty good. It does have a "natural" feel. It would have been nice to have a more private bathroom door. The maids were good and even came back and re-mopped our floor after the maintance men had to fix a leaking toilet. They put flowers on the bed each day. The pool was nice although we spent most of the time in the ocean. The swim up bar was fun. The bar above the swim up bar was a nice cool place to sit at night. Too bad the bartender, Francisco didn't work at night. He made the best banana mamas. The beach was great. We didn't have trouble finding a hut to sit under but if you want one right close to the water, you should go down early and reserve one. There was some sea grass floating but it wasn't slimy so it didn't really bother us. Plus, you are in the ocean so things will be floating from time to time. I felt so sorry for the worker who had to sweep it each day, put it in a wheel barrel and wheel it down the beach to where he dumped it for a truck to pick it up. And we all complain about our jobs!!!!! We went snorkeling to the left of the beach when you are looking at the water. There is a tree fallen down and there are two good locations. The better of the two, which is farther out is not real safe as it is outside the protected swim area and you have to watch out for speed boats coming by. There is also an area right outside the rope in the swim area that was nice. Make sure you take bread with you and your underwater camera. We took rafts to float out in the ocean and I would highly recommend doing that. Talk about relaxing. We bought cheap ones and then left them there instead of deflating. There are shops down the beach, but we found them not to be real cheap as in someother countries we have been to. You can deal with them, but it takes persistence on your part. I don't know if it is the same day each week, but Thursday night, they were up by the main buffet. Now about the food. It was pretty good, nothing great though. We definitely did not go hungry though. There is the main buffet which is where we had breakfast. Then there is the steak house, which we ate at and it was good. We did not eat at the Italian. My sister and brother in law ate at the seafood one night and said it was good. We usually ate lunch at the buffet by the pool as you could just walk in with your suits on and it had a beautiful view of the ocean. We noticed that men without long pants were eating in the steakhouse and the main buffet at night although we were told that you were supposed to wear long pants. So we tried it one night and didn't have any problems. There isn't much night life but that was ok since we were there with another couple. Not many people spoke English as a first language but we didn't have any trouble in terms of a language barrier. Now for a couple negatives, it rained briefly one night right before we ate dinner at the steakhouse by the pond. Just as we were finishing our meals, the mosquitos decided it was time for them to eat. But the staff was right there with bug spray although we still encountered many bites. So bring bug spray and be proactive and spray it on before you eat. You have to call for the mini fridge to be unlocked after you arrive and they lock it the day before you leave. But they did come get out the "free" stuff when we called and asked them to open it back up. So we got the sodas and the beers for the night, but they weren't cold. It would be nice if the fridge was just stocked with the freebies and then you wouldn't have that hassel. Also the electricity went off a couple times, but for 5-10 minutes tops. I still wished I had brought a flashlight. Also, there are no clocks so you might want to bring one. It didn't really bother us that much, since we weren't concerned with time.

We did pay the $50.00 for a late check out since our shuttle to the airport wasn't coming until 7:00 for our 10:20 flight. There is a small locker room that you can shower in but when we went to check it out, it was hot and the luggage area was not secured by a staff person.
reviews.title: Beautiful!
Spectacular!
reviews.text: As mentioned in other reviews, the is a switch that you have to keep something inserted into in order to keep your electricity on. When we got to our room, it was already going. Someone had stuck a brochure in it. So we didn't have any problems with that. It was slightly a pain to have to worry about the key to the safe. I like the code safes better, but I just took an extra key ring and put it on there or you could attach it to your room key. We felt safe leaving our things on the beach unattended but remember that your room key does have your room number on it so one could access your room and your safe if it was lost or stolen.
Overall, for the price we paid for the trip (we did get a really good deal), we thought the resort was great. We didn't venture off the resort so I cannot comment on anything off the resort.
reviews.title: A great time at a great price

reviews.text: We would good back to Punta Cana and would consider going back to the resort when we have seen the other places we want to go to or if we get another great deal.
reviews.title: Fabulous time at Natura Park

reviews.text: I had ready all of the reviews I could get my eyes on before we left, and I have to disagree with many, many of the complainers I read about. Yes, there was a bit of seaweed here and there and more on certain days, etc.; however, nothing overwhelming and certainly nothing to stop me from enjoying wading or swimming in the water. The buffet for breakfast and dinner did leave a bit to be desired, but I still managed to pack on some pounds, so there must have been enough to keep my hunger pangs from being outrageous - that and the constant food display down by the pool/beach throughout the day.
reviews.title: Fabulous!
I loved it
reviews.text: When we first arrived, our room was not was we requested (not a King bed), but once we found out and told them that's not what we asked for, next thing we knew, we were in our King-bed room.

reviews.title: A nice all inclusive
reviews.text: We didn't understand a whole lot of the people around us as we were minority speaking English, and found that to be the perfect thing for relaxing. We knew enough spanish to make our way around, as well as found several other couples who too spoke English if we really felt we needed to rattle off a conversation with someone other than ourselves and the excellent bartenders who were always fun to try and communicate back and forth with (by the way - Jose down at the beach bar is the man you need to see - a little Mamma Wanna each night and you'll be set).

reviews.title: Had a great time, but needs maintenance.
reviews.text: The resort is perfectly located down from a shopping area, as well as it offers snorkeling, horse-back riding, parasailing, sun bathing, exercise, sports, and there are reps who offer taking a boat to other places to get dinner and/or do shopping elsewhere. I recommend the Lobster/seafood place (Langosta del Caribe) about 15 minutes down the beach by boat - fabulous food, more shops to see (inside a little community) and all the drinks you can take in while you sit and dine through a several-course, great meal. It even downpoured while we were eating, and the Cana tree awnings provided all the protection we needed - didn't get a drop on us!

reviews.title: Grat Hotel
reviews.text: We brought the wash clothes as recommended in other reviews, but noticed there is one included in the hotel, it's just a little unnoticeable as it's in the basket under the shampoos, comb, etc. they provide for you... so if nobody ever seems to use it, yeah, I imagine people think the hotel doesn't have them. The room itself was cleaned very well, and the maid was excellent to us - leave a dollar next to the bottle of water and she'll bring you more bottles of water than you can even drink the next day.
It is not worth the money. For a little bit more, other hotels in the some area seem to offer better service.
reviews.title: not worth it
Dream Vacation that was more of a Nightmare......
reviews.text: We arrived quite late. There was only one person to help an entire group (more or less 15 persons) to the rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Once in the room, the lighting switch felt in the floor, the room wasn’t ready, had a terrible, terrible smell. I was chocked. I asked for another room, and it was given to me.
reviews.title: To Go or Not To Go

reviews.text: Don’t border to ask anything in the reception because they don’t do it. They don’t deliver messages; they give you conflicting information, even wake you up at wrong times.
reviews.title: Great spot for a vacation

reviews.text: In the last day, after checkout, you can have a shower and get ready for the flight. That is very nice. The only problem with that is that I had to ask 4 times for towels, which took 25 minutes to arrive. Very bad service.
reviews.title: Tropical Paradise

reviews.text: My family and I just got back from our stay at Natura Park. I am sorry to say the service is very poor and disipointing.
reviews.title: Bad Service, and watch your table

likes.disliked: — Service, Service, Service......... I don't think the staff understands the concept

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon our arrival we where given a bag with a room key, a safe key, and told that we would get our TV remote later that day, and if we did not return any of the items would be charged.
reviews.title: Wonderful, lush Natura Park

likes.liked: — The grounds were lush and inviting, truly envigorating.
likes.disliked: — internet service was in blocks of 15 min. should have code and pay for time and keep unused time for later

reviews.text: When we arrived it was around three o'clock in the afternoon. We where strongly advised to go directly to get something to eat because luch would only be served for a few more minutes, and then there would be nothing to eat. This is pretty much how the whole trip went with the Natura Park Staff. As a guest you better be where they say, when they say or you will not get anyting to eat and or drink. When you do meet the schedule, getting waited on is another challenge. Most of the guest would just get up an get their own drinks out of frustration of waiting for someone to take an order. If you did this you had to make sure that someone was still setting at the table becaue the staff would very quickly remove any items from the table and set someone else down at your table. We actually saw other guest plates of food taken off the table because they went to get something to drink. In additon if you did this you would wait in line to get a drink, pretty much 15-20 minutes each time due to the long line of people waiting.
reviews.title: Not a great resort

likes.liked: — the service and the reception on arrival

reviews.title: Over rated
reviews.text: Our fridge was locked in our room, and after repeated attempts to get it unlocked I finally just gave up. We never got any pop, beer or anything out of the fridge. Due to this issue.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Out of our four day three night stay, the internet and information we recieved from our travel company said we would get two specailty dinners (at the resturants) The staff was quick to tell us that we could have one dinner with our stay and that was it.
reviews.title: Beuatiful beach but rooms and food was hurting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I will return to Natura Park for sure.
reviews.title: Gorgeous Natura Park

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Why?
reviews.title: Relaxing Vacation in the Sun

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First of all we loved the artwork of the this very clean resort, with warm flamingo-pink painted buildings, surrounded by luxuriant vegetation, various kinds of palm trees, mangroves and flowering plants.
reviews.title: average resort

reviews.text: Then we loved the beach with pink-white sand, the warm turquoise ocean waters and the shadowing palm trees, where we enjoyed the most part of our day, sipping our pina-coladas, reading a book or just napping in the shade.
reviews.title: Would Never Recommend to anyone

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Natura Park for three nights in August, 2006. It was an Apple Vacation that we booked through a travel agent. We had an absolutely wonderful time. Before we left I read the reviews on this site and took the advice of other reviewers re: bug spray, lots of $1 bills and taking coozies to keep our drinks cool, etc.
reviews.title: Can't wait to go back!

reviews.text: We arrived at our hotel about 30 min. after leaving the airport. Our check in was very comprehensive and the staff was very good at explaining the mini bar (what was included, what wasn't etc.) and how to turn on the power in the room.
reviews.title: Do you really want to get away? Then this is the place.

reviews.text: A porter carried our bags to the room and showed us everything in the room. Everything was very clean and the room was practically freezing when we got there and stayed freezing throughout our stay. The power had been kept on by a brochure that was already in the slot by the door.
reviews.title: Very Nice Trip.

likes.disliked: — Far Walk to Main Food and Such

reviews.text: We never lost power nor lost hot water while we were there. We also never had a problem communicating in the resort. My husband and I learned the basics but are really not Spanish speakers. But keep in mind you are in a spanish-speaking country, staying at a resort owned by Spaniards in which I would estimate 95% of the guests are Spanish speaking. It will serve you well to learn some Spanish. We are all guests in their country and should act accordingly.
reviews.title: Tropical Paradise

reviews.text: My husband, the picky one, LOVED the food, I thought it was okay. I certainly could always find something that I liked, even if I didn't know exactly what it was. My husband had no bowel problems. I did, but nothing major. (Immodium was my friend!) Since my husband practically gorged himself at every meal and had no problems, I think my problems were more due to the fact that the food was different, than it was that the food was spoiled or bad. We ate at the Seafood a la carte restaurant. It was wonderful. The lobster was awesome!
reviews.title: Engaged on the beach!

reviews.text: Just arrived back from a Sunquest vacation to the Blau Natura Park. It is hard to give an overall impression of the hotel as some things were great, while others poor.
reviews.title: Beautiful looking, but hit or miss on everything else

likes.disliked: — No consistency in service, accomodations or food

reviews.text: The hotel is a short 20 minute drive from the airport (nice looking airport, but the staff will try to extort as much money from you as they can...). It really is in the middle of nowhere, and the area is not pleasant smelling once you get off the resort property.
reviews.title: Natura Park Vacation

reviews.text: The property itself is quite nice, more natural looking than most - with the exception of the fish ponds/lagoons that are very clearly artificial. It is fun to see and feed the fish and birds that are all over the place. The buildings incorporate a lot of natural materials, which give it a more rustic feel. The beach is a decent size, but there is a lot of seaweed. This is mainly due to the strong winds (which actually help keep you comfortable during the day).
reviews.title: Don't Waste your money or Time

reviews.text: The rooms were a disappointment. Everything in them smells musty, and we had little ants of some kind in the bathroom and on the desk. Thankfully, they didn't get into our stuff. The beds were harder than any futon I've ever slept on, and I had a sore neck all week as a result. The electricity is definitely an issue - some of the lights didn't work, and a surge blew out my battery charger. We did have hot water and the A/C worked well, so we were lucky compared to some. Don't travel with anyone you might be shy around, as the bathroom doors are made of slotted wood, and only slide back and forth. Note that noise carries pretty easily, especially near the theatre.
reviews.title: Natura Park - Punta Cana

reviews.text: The food was hit or miss. Generally, when the meat was cooked properly, it was quite flavourful. The pasta was generally okay. There were issues with keeping food hot though, and both me and my friend ended up with intestinal problems (and when they say don't drink the water from the taps, this includes brushing your teeth!). The a la carte restaurants weren't anything special.
reviews.title: punta caca

likes.liked: — the room the food the resort

reviews.text: -Well, my family and I just got back from the Natura Park in the Dominican Republic and we found it very beautiful! The grounds were very well kept and the wild life was great.
reviews.title: Amazing time at the Natura Park resort!

reviews.text: - The rooms are very nicely done and the maids are very out going. If you have a problem in your room you can call the front desk or go down to talk to them in person. But be patient, it seems the hotel staff are more fluent in French then they are English.
reviews.title: Nice but

reviews.text: - The service at the eateries are a little slow....but heck your on a vacation! No need to hurry. We tried the Seafood and Stakehouse eateries and they were absolutly fabulous! The service in those two were exceptional. But be sure to book a couple of days ahead if you want to eat in them because they fill up quickly.
reviews.title: was completely amazing!!! would go back in a heartbeat!

likes.liked: — the friendly people...and the constant entertainement
likes.disliked: — that it went by so fast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - YOu can find huge conch shells. Just walk 30-40 min down the strech of beach to where no resorts are. Don;t worry it is safe, there is security all along there.
reviews.title: Not a relaxing or peaceful resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The kids had a lot of fun, and the pool was oh so refreshing when you went in.
reviews.title: Last minute deal a limited success!

reviews.text: OKay.. im 20 and I went with my family.. if you're looking for a high energy place.. not the best place to be...! Also beware of someof the food.. really messed with our stomachs, primarily produce.. but with that aside the food was awesome!! Bars were great.. go see daniel at the lobby bar.. best barman EVER! Met so many awesome people too! Beach is so nice but watch the vendors and the activity people.. they will HOUND you! Bring some pepto and get ready for a very quiet and relaxing time!
reviews.title: It was fun!

likes.liked: — The rooms were nice and clean
likes.disliked: — No disco.. air conditioning did not work

reviews.text: My one complaint is to really WATCH YOUR STUFF.. i got my camera stolen and another girl got her purse taken from the lobby bar.. just watch your things and you're good to go!
reviews.title: Beautiful gardens--Nice beach

likes.liked: — no ice---no elevators--alot of UFO's (unidentified food objects)
likes.disliked: — only eat things you can identify

reviews.text: APPLE VACATIONS---MALE employees fell all over us--we're both american blonde pretty females--the female employees except for the housekeeping staff were catty & rude. Both made us uncomfortable. The resort was too large for my taste--it was kind of dirty but not to the point of gross. The beaches & gardens were absolutely beautiful. The worst thing we saw were women & men wearing very unflattering swimwear for their bodies--but it was quite comical...to see a 50 year old 300 lb woman in a bikini--but hell if you have the guts & confidence more power to ya sista!!!!!!! Who is anybody to judge!!
reviews.title: ok spot

reviews.text: We travelled as group of 12 over Christmas. We found the grounds to be very well maintained, the rooms large and adequate. We did not experience issues with mosquitoes as other travellers have mentioned - perhaps time of year makes a difference. The food as far as taste was pretty much what we expected from the Dominican - average. A la carte restaurants were nice to break up the buffet selections (beef tenderloin was excellent). A little warm at night if you were seated at the back of buffet area or to watch shows. I would say probably 9-10 out of the 12 experienced some sort of stomach upset. The beach for swimming was a bit disappointing, but nice to walk along. No real problem getting chairs. Pool is a bit dated and not that inviting. Overall though, not a bad place. It is pretty much what we expected when we booked.
reviews.title: The PRICE was right, resort okay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My amiga and I returned Jan. 8 from a 7-night stay in Punta Cana at the Natura Park Resort and Spa. Our overall experience was good. We are twentysomething girls who were looking for a relaxing time on the beach. Other times we have gone to Cancun and partied the night away. This time we opted for something a little less "Girls Gone Wild."
reviews.title: beautiful place/faceless hosts

likes.disliked: — Snob dominican attiudes towards USA Guests

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms: for a 5* hotel the cleanliness was at a very low level. The shower drain was clogged. Although there was a mosquito net, we fought with mosquitoes every night - apparently the room maid left the doors long enough opened so that they could easily come inside. There were also a big variety of other bugs living in our room, a cockroach-family included.
reviews.title: Not worth it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service: half of the bartenders and the waiters in the restaurants were really friendly. The other half of the personnel was arrogant and unmotivated to do their job. Some days before we left, the air conditioner got broken. We complained at least 3 times before they sent us a technician, who needed 3 days (every time he came without any warning) to repair it. At the end he apparently changed it with a new one, which got broken the same night:( Fortunately we left the next day.
reviews.title: Perfect Paradise

reviews.text: Food: The same [--], different day! The salads were not fresh, the meat was almost every time burnt and the dessert was full with bugs. The a-la-carte-restaurants weren't much better. Two or three times they cooked for lunch outside, near the beach. The paellas were really good, so don't miss it. If you like wine, you'd better bring some bottles from home. The cocktails taste the one like the other.
reviews.title: Nice vacations in Natura

reviews.text: Pool and Beach: The pool is very small compared to the room capacities of the hotel. If you want a chair at the pool, you have to get up early. The beach is nice, not overcrowded and kept clean every day. If you want to visit a really beautiful Carribean beach, I'll recommend you a trip to the Saona island:)
reviews.title: Hmmmm ...

likes.disliked: — Tired rooms in need of a refit. Lack of aircon in public spaces.

reviews.text: My husband and I enjoyed our relaxing stay at Natura. We were a litte nervous due to the past reviews we read. The weather was perfect. We thought the buffet could of been better . It seemed to be the same food every night. The steak restaurant was our favorite. We had a ribeye that tasted wonderful. The italian restaurant was ok. We did not experience the seafood restaurant..
reviews.title: Spend a couple of more dollars and go elsewhere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have done Apple for Cancun and Apple for Punta Cana. Skip this one and go to Cancun. You will get a lot more for your money.
reviews.title: Beautiful, friendly (for the most part) but one problem after another

likes.disliked: — Food often not good. They cut corners all over the place. They do little they promise to do.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First. the good part. It is a beautiful place and the staff is mostly very friendly, even when they are promising you faithfully that they will do something for you that they have absolutely no intention of doing. The beach is nice and there was no toplessness. The pool is nice. There were no insects. They accept American money, even out on the economy, so there is no need to change money. The weather couldn't have been better. No problems with European guests. They were very nice and many spoke English. We did not get sick, as we almost always do in Mexico.
reviews.title: Save your money!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now the bad part. There is a drumbeat of one maddening annoyance after another. They cut corners shamelessly on all the included stuff and the non-included stuff is very expensive.
reviews.title: Everything was as told - 100% satisfied
our favorite!
reviews.text: We flew out of Cleveland and had to get up at 3:30 in the morning to make our flight. We arrived at Natura Park at about eleven local time. By the time we got through the check-in line it was 11:30 local time, and we were dead, dead tired. The clerk told us that our room would not be ready until 1:00 and we should go and get something to eat. He told us to put our luggage in an unlocked storage room out of the view of the main desk, along with all the rest of the new arrivals. When we can back at 1:00, the same clerk said the check in time was 3:00 and he about bit my wife's head off when she mentioned that he had said 1:00. However, that was the only time anyone was rude to us there. The chairs in the lobby were very uncomfortable. It was well past 3:00 before we got our room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was mostly alright. It had a very large bed that was very hard. The air conditioning was adequate. The toilet wouldn't flush. They fixed that right away, but it ran loudly the whole time we were there. There was only one electrical outlet in the room that shared the very small and very dim television in the room with the coffee maker and my lap top computer. It took a constant stream of requests to get coffee for the coffee maker. You had to reach past exposed wires to get to the outlet. There was an ice bucket, but no ice machine anywhere. I can't imagine what the place would be like if you did not speak Spanish, which I do -- very well. The maid promised us over and over again to bring us ice, but never did. The place is in the middle of no where. You can't get off the premises without expensive transportation. The cab was twenty dollars each way and all I saw off premises was shops that sold poor quality tourist stuff.
reviews.title: Mixed Opinion
Not so bad.
reviews.text: My wife and I just got back from Natura and had a GOOD time. We are both in our mid thirties and we found the resort to be nice. The food is decent and the weather is awesome. the landscaping is beautiful and our roome was mostly clean. If you have never been there are some things you might want to know about this place:

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. Mini bar has only two beers and two Pepsi's. Good luck getting them refilled quickly.
reviews.title: Enjoyed myself

likes.disliked: — The smoking in Bars and where nightly shows were

reviews.title: Do motor boats really need to come this close to the beach?
reviews.text: 2. If your looking for a lounge chair by the pool to kick up your feet and relax, you better get up before 6am and take you towel out to the pool and claim your territory. If you don't, I hope you like concrete?
3. Do not go to the Palma Real mall. Of the 33 stores claimed to be in operation, 12 were true to their word.
reviews.title: The HORROR!

reviews.text: 4. Kirby at Conquest tours was absolutely useless. He showed three hours late for orientation and blamed us for the mistake. On this note get use to time deadlines not being made by employees.
reviews.title: So... So

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at Natura from January 2 to January 9, 2007 and there isn't much to say except phenominal. Our experience was wonderful. From the white sand beach (that felt like flour) to the steady flow of drinks all the way back at the main bar we had no complaints with the resort at all.
reviews.title: Vacation of a lifetime

likes.liked: — Too much to pick just one thing
likes.disliked: — The front desk staff and the sunwing rep

reviews.text: The service was exceptional, sure there were some lanquage barriers (thank god I learned to count in spanish from Dora) but if you tried hard so did they. As far as tipping goes....It's totally worth the small expenditure to get even better service. An example of this would be in regards to the sea weed that washes up on the beach. On the Thursday of our trip my wife and I tossed each of the 3 guys who raked the beach a couple of bucks and from that day on there was never sea weed around us, each time some would show up the crew would wisk it away with a big smile and a nod....Great guys who work a horrible job, why not say thank you.
reviews.title: An average all-inclusive vacation

reviews.text: Flavio and Sandro at the main bar are two of the nicest and happiest people I've ever met, they were always trying to chat with us and it was a fluke if my glass was empty for more than 30 seconds. They were great and that made our experience that much better. The front desk staff were not good at all but hey once I had my room key I didn't have to see them again.
reviews.title: Great vacation in the Sun

reviews.text: The food was good in all the eateries, the buffet always had something tasty to eat and the a'la cartes were good too. My only complaints are: 1 - Italian = the lasagna tasted like undercooked hamburger helper. 2 - Seafood - The shrimp pasta made me ill. No bid deal I was over it in after a good sleep.
reviews.title: quiet resort

likes.liked: — my suite with the excellent view

reviews.title: Solid Lodgings
reviews.text: The Sunwing rep - now that was a joke, totally useless and didn't care about anything unless you were handing him cash for an excursion (no doubt that he earned a cut of).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm so happy to see other reviews that could very well be my own.
reviews.title: Go at own risk - and then with low expectations

likes.disliked: — Culinary capabilities and cleanliness of all aspects of dining facilities.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I set our expectations low to begin with so we wouldn't be disappointed. All we really wanted to do was get away for 3 days. We thought it would be cool to try an all-inclusive and imagined ourselves in a Corona commercial munching on some yummy tropical food. Well, we will never do another all-inclusive and next time I go to any resort, I'm packing peanut butter and jelly; and 2 boxes of Immodium instead of 1.
reviews.title: Excellent Vacation
Loved it There
reviews.text: We were pleasantly surprised by the architecture of the main building and the grounds. We were also surprised by the 20 mph winds coming in off the beach. Obviously we can't fault them for Mother's Nature nature but a write-up somewhere would have been nice.

We can, however, fault them for the nastiest food I've ever tasted and I'm comparing this to summer camps, college dorm food and an Outward Bound trip where I ate rehydrated black beans and powdered pasta sauce. Considering food is a large part of the all-inclusive appeal - we were seriously ripped off.
reviews.title: It must be a terrible place to work!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were never able to get reservations to the restaurants even though they weren't full every night. So we ate at the buffet for 3 days. After day 1 we learned to stick to the bread, rice and pasta but still were hit with some intestinal thing (1 week later we both still have aftershocks). Maybe it's from the guy who licked his hands while grilling the hotdogs and hamburgers. Or it could be from the server who merely turned table cloths over instead of getting clean ones (she also drank out of the leftover wine bottles and ate leftover food off people's plates). Or maybe it was from the dirty silverware, glasses and dishes. Or maybe from people touching my food with their bare hands. Let's all be thankful for the FDA.
reviews.title: Stay away
We had an amazing vacation!
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from a wonderfully relaxing holiday at Natura Park. Thanks to the mixed reviews for the resort, we weren't sure what to expect. However, we found the staff to be incredibly friendly and accomodating, the food to be great and plentiful (especially the wonderful juice bar at breakfast), the grounds, pool, and beach to be BEAUTIFUL, and our air-conditioned room to be fantastic (and not at ALL run down). We loved the open-air structure of the main building, which contains the buffet restaurant, performance stage, a bar, a game room, an internet access room, the gift shop and reception. I especially enjoyed passing by flamingos, ducks, peacocks, and geese (which were nesting!) during every walk through the grounds.

reviews.title: Resort of Pardox!-Better know some espanol.
reviews.text: I know some people were upset that your key needs to be inserted into a slot on the wall of the room for the lights to work, but that is simply because Natura Park is an "Eco Resort" that is making a very welcome effort to save energy. One of the helpful resort staff walked us to our room after we checked in and showed us how it worked. My husband and I were extremely pleased to note the many efforts that the management is making to conserve energy and resources while still accomodating guests to an extremely high quality! Personally, I don't know why people would want to keep the lights on in their room while they are not in it anyway.

My husband and I were at the resort for six days and could easily have spent another week there. We didn't even partake in all of the free activities that were available (such as paddle boating, a SCUBA lesson in the pool, and wind surfing) because we were so occupied with other activies...as well as simply relaxing!! We did go kayaking and snorkeling, played tennis every day, went on a fantastic excursion during which we were able to drive speed boats and snorkel at a beautiful nearby coral reef, attended the evening entertainment (performed by resort staff with incredible dancing talent and great senses of humor), and enjoyed the pool bar :)
reviews.title: Resort rooms are very run down and outdated

reviews.text: We are not wealthy people and do not have the funds to go to a so-called "five star" resort, but I certainly don't understand why Natura Park is not rated higher than it is. My husband and I would return in a heartbeat. My one piece of advice is to bring a large supply of sunblock because it is very expensive in the gift shop - between $14 to $27 per bottle. We had to buy some when ours ran out. Otherwise, we had a perfect experience and we highly recommend this resort to anyone who wants to relax in a gorgeous location surrounded by travelers from around the world and the most friendly resort staff I have ever had the pleasure of knowing.
reviews.title: Good snorkeling location
Great time
reviews.text: Stayed here May29th-June5th-06.This may be longwinded but if you read before you consider this resort it may help.On the bus ride to airport as we were departing we were handed a map of places to go,things to see.Might have been useful upon arrival.Upon checking out 4 hrs prior to flight home found front desk failed to give us our bus pass to ID us .Took 4hrs the day before and 1 hour at checkout to review the phone charges.Don't dial9 from your room trying to use AT&T prepaid Sams cards-NO GOOD.Everytime you use the room phone they charge $3US wether you connect or not.Took our duaghter 5 tries to get us from home to our room due to fact at front desk there was few if anyone on duty that understood english to transfer her calls, so she spoke to everyone in the resort but us.Apple representative either sick or dancing but rarely at his desk,so no real help here.Booked a few activities.Deep sea fishing went like this.Met row boat to go to Barbavro marina at 7:30am.Got onto boat by 8am.Waited for the Capt.to find more anglers til9:30am. The 4 hr. trip ended in 2and a half at 12noon.My wife caught a 40lb.Dorado which I paid $40US to fillet and after zip locking gave to the Capt. and 1st mate except for 6 to 8 lbs.of prime fillet.Iced down and took back to Natura Park to grill.Told my fish was toxic and a health risk to all the other guests if they allowed it to be cooked on pemise.Told us to go to the Allegro up the beach and have them cook it.Told MGT. if I needed to do this I would stay at the Allegro.Strange thing is the two employees I gave the fish fillets took it gladly and after they and their families consumed,did'nt die or get sick,Go Figure!Asked for some peanuts at two different bars at resort.One time got sliced pineapple and the second time got toothpicks.Monday and weds. the resort allows Carribean market vendors at the main restaurant.If you like being harassed and totally bothered then you'll like this scene.The gems are cheaper on the beach as well as much better quality.If your in the market for blue rocks and petrified tree sap set in .925 silver then buy it in town or at the giftshop.Entertainment repetitive but energetic.Service from Kelvin at the main restaurant was really superior.This guy went out of his way to make your stay pleasant.Food good and plenty to choose from.If we go back to Punta cana will book a golden apple 6 star at Barbavro.This was like camping out inside.Lastly the value for the $ was OK.,but unless they learn more english this resort is an effort.Funny thing is all the employees as well as MGT. love the US buck.I know this is mostly negative but true.Comments made by the travel agents on this resort should be listened to. I will focus on forgetting the bad and planning better for our next trip.

I am a travel agent, that really enjoys the out of the ordinary places to stay. High rises are all over the US, and island vacation needs to be just that. And Natura Park was all that. Low keyed, but so comfortable. Great people to work with and enjoy their company. Great food, entertainment, beautiful beach, Saona Island recommended by front desk staff, it was amazing. No language barrier, but then I don't ever go to other countries and expect them to adapt to my language or my culture, I go to enjoy theirs. Meals were wonderful and plentiful, the grounds were above excellent, the animals and plant life beautiful. The maids made our stay so nice and special, flowers on the beds, the desk staff, Kary, Delbins, Analisa, so helpful with suggestions, and all the Dominican people, a wonderful stay. I've been everywhere in Mexico and the Caribbean, this was to date the most relaxing.
reviews.title: Beautiful, perfect Island vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Paradise Found!! For many years we had been going to an European Resort near Tulum, Mexico which was sold a few years ago and closed a couple of years ago. We especially liked that resort because of its ‘rustic” feel and the blend of nationalities and cultures. We’ve been looking for a replacement and finally found it at Natura Park in Punta Cana.
reviews.title: Paradise Found!

likes.liked: — The friendliness and the laid back rustic atmosphere. Different nationalities

reviews.text: It’s been a few months since we visited and we’ve been looking at some of the comments since we got back and wanted to give you our comments. We’ve been to numerous all inclusive resorts all over the Caribbean, Mexico and as far away as Bora Bora.
reviews.title: For a little bit more, other hotels in the some area seem to offer better servic

reviews.text: We had a fantastic vacation at Natura Park. Along with some Americans and Canadians, we met guests from South America, Spain, Tenerife, Italy, France, England and a whole bunch from Russia – yes, they have a jumbo jet that comes from Moscow each week.
reviews.title: Just OK, Service not good here.............

likes.liked: — The Beautiful Grounds, Beach and Pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Prior to our visit we had read many reviews and we were not sure what to expect but we were pleasantly surprised. The resort is somewhat typical in layout where there is plenty of space. The main building with reception, main restaurant, lobby bar, shops and entertainment is located someway from the beach. At the beach is another restaurant that serves lunch and becomes the seafood specialty restaurant in the evening. There is also a snack bar, beach bar, swim up pool bar and all the sports activities. The rooms are located on each side of the “corridor” between the main building and the beach in 2 and 3-story buildings. However, what’s really unique and charming are the gardens and ponds in this central corridor. The vegetation is truly tropical and there are bridges over the streams and ponds. There is fish and lots of wildlife – flamingos, geese, ducks, peacocks, etc. They stock the “feed boxes” daily with stale bread and it’s fun to get them eating out of your hands!!
reviews.title: Fantastic holiday at natura park

likes.disliked: — the dirt when you were outside the resort

reviews.title: Think twice before going!!!
reviews.text: We just came back from Natura Park March 19 2004. We would not recommend this resort to anyone!!! We have been to Mexico a few times and our trips there far exceeded our tip to Punta Cana. We were given a room far in the back corner of the resort where the patio faced a dirt road (not even part of the resort). Our shower curtain was covered in stains and gave off an awful smell, and we also found a few cockroaches in our room - and they were not small by any means. The food in the buffet was okay, however the speciality restaurants were quite dissapointing. We must have caught a bug from something we ate because we were sick during and a week after our trip.On the good side, the beach was extremely beautiful and for the most part, the staff was quite friendly. Many of the reviews on this site rave about this place, but our experience was quite the opposite. If you are planing a trip to Punta Cana, I recommend you think of trying a newer resort, and one with a higher star rating. This place, was far from being a four star.

reviews.title: Day Trips sold on the beach
reviews.text: Our stay at Natura Park on the whole was a good one.We enjoyed the food and our hotel room was nice and clean. We were bumped to another resort the first night we arrived and according to people we talked to on the beach overbooking especially on the weekend is de rigeur for Natura Park. The nightly entertainment was slightly amateurish and is not something that would make us want to return. The staff was friendly and helpful but unorganized at times. At check-in we were not told we needed to put a down-payment of $20.00 US or no remote control OR that we needed to ask to have someone unlock our fridge which made our first two hours in our room frustrating with returns and calls to the front desk. A few items of clothing went missing from our room. Some calls to their laundry for the articles, which just happened to be nice lingerie, went unanswered. People walk-in from the beach and use the bars, beach buffet and the night club and main buffet. I think this resort could use identification bracelets. One person to avoid on the beach is a young man named ORLANDO who sells short day-trips to a restaurant called Lagoustine for $40.00 US pp. He'll tell you you are going to see the Natura Pools and then go to the restaurant for lunch and that you get two free gifts you choose from Lagoustines gift shop. What happens is that you get dropped off at the restaurant a mile up the beach and you are given 2 for $1.00 items . No choice of gifts, no swim at the Natura Pools. The restaurant itself is a good beach restaurant but they should get rid of the guy putting $20.00 US grass hats on patrons heads while they're eating and the guy snapping your picture and trying to sell you a bottle of cheap rum with your picture on it for $15.00 US while you eat your dessert. The meal and boat ride there (we were told there would be 6 people in our boat and 14 showed up) weren't worth $80.00 US a couple. It's a gaff. Natura Park should simply get rid of this guy. There are other ways to get to see other areas including water taxis you can rent. The hotel beach was crowded but you can find a quiet spot up an endless beach. There are sand fleas so bring bug spray.

reviews.title: We are going back!
reviews.text: We traveled to Natura Park a year ago last November and had a very good time. We hated to leave and felt that it was a little piece of paradise. It is all that the other POSITIVE reviewer's said it is but I have something I would like to add. Something happened that could have been a disaster for us but thanks to our maid all turned out fine. My husband had opened the safe to get some money out and got distracted and forgot to lock it before we left to go to the beach for the day.

reviews.title: King Cesar to the rescue
reviews.text: You can imagine the horror we felt when we returned to the room and found the safe open and empty. It contained our money and passports. We quickly found out that the maid found it open and gave everything to the manager. Everything was returned to us. You can be sure we tipped her well. So for all the other nice things other reviewers have already said about the doninicans I need to add honesty. We are returning there in three weeks and I am really looking forward to that gorgeous beach and a massage while lying under a cabanna on it.

reviews.title: Smooth Operation!
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Natura Park the first week of March 2004. It is beautiful and the beaches- like a picture postcard. We had requested a king bed. The gal in reception told us we got one, but when we entered the room we saw two small doubles. My husband and I sleep in a king bed at home and the first night of our vacation, we had to sleep in separate beds. It had been a long day of traveling and we were not happy about this, especially since we were celebrating our 5th wedding anniversary. The same thing happened to us in Riviera Maya at the Palladium last year at this time. Both trips were booked through Apple Vacations and our travel agent was very upfront that we could only make the request, but it wasn't guarenteed. It would be nice if it was an option to pay more and get it. We were disappointed, but our Apple Vacations Rep at Natura saved the day. His name is Cesar and he made sure we got the king the next day. He deserves a raise because at first we thought...that's it, we're done with Apple. Cesar took care of us and his kindness and attention to detail are superb. We will travel with Apple again and can hopefully find a place that can guarentee requests. We met a lot of nice people, including a couple from Cincinatti, Ohio and Brian and John, the dive instructors from Canada.

We arrived at Natura Park @ 12.30 PM on;y to find our rooms were not ready.We did not get into our rooms until 5PM. My opinion is has follows:,the beach was great ,weather was perfect, the food was ok. Most of the staff were very nice,front desk was much to be desired.
reviews.title: Not A Good Experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room on the other hand was a nightmare.
reviews.title: Thank God I Got Home !!!!!

likes.disliked: — bedbug,s . food , general cleanliness of resort

reviews.text: The pictures of the room are not what they appear to be.There was no air conditioning ,our TV didn't work,called front desk for service aleast 4 times for towel's & water & to fix the TV .I was always told they would send someone , but no one ever showed up. On our departure the TV was still not fixed (2DAYS)when they said they would send someone to fix it. If I was to return it would not be at Natura PARK. My family and I were on vacation to relax and enjoy our time together which we did during the day,but at night returning to our rooms was very upsetting. In my opinion this was not a relaxing vacation. Time & money not spent very well.
reviews.title: loved it

reviews.text: I am writing this on father,s day a wee gift to myself i suppose, We went to this here natural park got a good deal 1680.00 for 2 week,s each . I read all 400 review,s and many bad ones.s pictures of filth , bug,s , but many good one s basiacally a decent beach that is about it , well i have a lot to say and all is 100% the truth for i would not be writing this i want the public the hard working public too know do not go here , if you want to be treated like you never existed go for it . we arrived Feb/28 / o8 . as we approached the resort for over a mile ton,s of garbage all over /// not a good site too see/// at all ,make s one wonder why they not have men cleaning it , first impression,s and all !! I had e-mailed ahead asking for a king size bed and they had a disco and from what i read booming noise late into night , i have hearing disorder and need a semi quiet place , also have severe tinnitus , so loud noise a taboo , i asked please no disco area , is a big resort should of been no problem .
reviews.title: Beautiful Grounds

reviews.text: Well i guess it was ,,, for we got a room right next to disco if i had known what laid ahead i would of stayed there no question,s asked , first off no cold fridge !! no air conditoning , bed was like rock hard , and when i opened back security door it fell right off the wall against me just fell of the wall ,,,whole door !!! I flipped the porter as i will call them a few buck,s , and he got us a room a good 7 minute walk which is good to the end of resort near the beach .
reviews.title: Hospitalized for three days

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This resort is exactly what you should expect for 4 star in the D.R. I have stayed in a few different places in the Carribean from Mexico Cuba and the D.R. Trust me it wasnt that bad. There are a few things that were not what most would want but if you want an economical place to stay, this is probably the place to be. I stayed 5 star in Cuba which was much worse than this. Its small and tranquil. The beach is incredible.The rooms are small but how much time do you spend there. Many will have problems with the lack of variety in the food.You will get board with the food after a couple of days, but you shouldnt go hungry. You can break this up with a few a la carts. I reccomend the steakhouse The beach grill is good, so is the buffet down at the beach. Alcohol is all low end brands but are drinkable. As far as getting sick as I said this is my 5th time to the Carribean and havent been sick yet. Most of the reasons that people get ill here is by way of habit. Eating too much is a big one, how often does one have the opportunity to stuff themselves full of a wide variety of different food as many times a day as they want and drink their guts out at the same time, no wonder they get sick. Pace yourself your body is not used to many of these habits. Not washing there hands, using the tap water for brushing teeth. I always carry alcohol hand wash for after using the washrooms or after touching areas that many people are around etc.Use the bottled water for your teeth. Stay away from mayo based salad dressings and cold meats. Keep an open mind and just enjoy the weather after all you are in a country where the sun will bake you inside of a half hour.Use sun screen often. I reccomend spf 30+ if you have fair skin. Drink lots of water. Ask for extra in you room.Drink the two they give you regardless of how much else you drink, every day. Heat exhaustion and dehydration are another big cause of illness,they often present as poisoning Enjoy the weather, enjoy the people around you.Open your mind and your heart will follow.I welcome your email if you have any questions.
reviews.title: what you should expect for 4 star D.R

reviews.text: Just arrived back from a week at Natura. We had an excellent experience. The grounds are beautiful. The ponds with many types of birds (flamingos, etc) was a nice touch, especially travelling with a 3 year old.
reviews.title: Excellent value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was fine. For the price of the resort, it is exactly what I would expect. Buffet food was good, but repetitious. The italian and steak restaurants were good. Seafood was fine, nothing special. None of us got remotely sick from the food.
reviews.title: Honest Review from and Honest Person

likes.disliked: — There wasn't anything we did not like.

reviews.text: The staff was helpful and cheerful. We never found a problem with waiting for drinks at any of the bars (including swimming pool and beach bars).
reviews.title: Natura Park Diarrhea Resort & Spa

likes.liked: — Fourteen of sixteen in our group beacame ill with gastroenteritis.What more can I say?

reviews.text: The beach is beautiful. Unfortunately the last half of the week, there was a storm in the area and therefore the waves were large and brought a large amount of seaweed onto the beach. The staff worked hard at clearing it.
reviews.title: Great Time!

likes.liked: — The ocean, grounds, room and staff

reviews.title: Keep Expectations Low
reviews.text: 1st night NO AIRCONDITONING & our fridge was LOCKED in our room which holds our "free beer and soft drinks" plus other items you can pay for which we didn't do. They didn't open our fridge for 3 days...which cost us precious time away from the beach to constantly check up on this complaint.

reviews.title: Loved it!
reviews.text: Date of stay: January 06-13, 2007

reviews.title: Great getaway and very relaxing atmosphere
reviews.text: My husband and I went for three days during spring break. We were lucky that it wasn't the crowded partying getaway spot. The resort was very well maintained with a variety of birds, turtles and wildlife. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Our room was fantastic. We definitely enjoyed it. The all inclusive made it easier as we didn't have to plan where we will dine. The buffet food was very good as well. Definitely a great resort and good value!

reviews.title: The Good, The Bad & The Ugly
reviews.text: The Good: The grounds were lovely with varying flowers & palm trees, flamingo & coy ponds, winding pathways & bridges with flamingos, egrets, gesse, ducks and turtles all the way down to the beach. Best stretch of beach compared to Allegro & Sunscape ("American" toursit hotel) which were to right of Natura. They had the marina in front so there was a lot more seaweed and tons of boats in the water when you went in, not pretty to look at. To the left was miles of empty beach so you could walk down for miles & enjoy the peace and scenery. The rooms were nice, we had a 3rd floor with cathederal ceiling & walk in closet. Plaid upholstery needed updating. Tipped the maid $2 per day, left a cryptic message in my best Spanish & got all we asked for & more, except no clean towels one day. The staff seemed to work endlessly & hard long days. The overall landscaping and layout of the grounds was much nicer than Allegro or Sunscape (eventhough Sunscape was American oriented, had air conditioned restarunts & a hopping disco).

reviews.title: breathtaking vacation
reviews.text: Went horseback rididng out by Breezes, the resort & beach were gorgeous, no seaweed, ice blue ocean. Try to pick a resort further from the airport (40 mins to an hour) like Breezes, Secrets Excellence, Iberostar Bavaro, or Melia Caribe Tropicale for the best beaches and service. It's a longer trip but worth it.

reviews.title: Would Definitely Not Go Back to Natura Spa & Resort
reviews.text: The Bad: No air conditioning 1st night, had to leave balcony door open & could not sleep because of droning music somewhere on the beach all night long. This was fixed next day the all was well. The food was the exact same every single day & night. Although it was just okay, they need more variety, it got really old, really fast. The specialty restaurants were no better, my chicken was raw at the Steakhouse when served to me. (Satyed at Iberostar in Puerto Plata last year & all food, shows, beach, pool & service was awesome). None of the restaurants were air conditioned nor where the bars, which were all thatched roof "open air". Although this was nice, the show room got way too hot (there was no air circulation) & we didn't see more than 15 minutes of any show . I knew of the language barrier before going so tried to speak and much (cryptic) Spanish as possible, but I'm sorry, I think at least the bartenders should speak English. Even the europeans who tried to order in English had a problem. I ended up translating for this nice German man. The pool was REALLY SMALL compared to the pictures. The swim up bar had visible mold under the counter and on the outside walls as you appproached which was a turn off & can easily be cleaned. The waterfall entry to bar was nice but the kids wanted to play in it (who can blame them), so they were jumping of barstools and splashing around the swim up bar, very annoying for adults. The pool was dirty most of the time with debris, dead bugs & a film of suntan lotion. I knew there was no disco, so night life after shows was boring. They really need to add one & there is room, so why not. Refused to get up early to play the usual & predictable "reserve a chair" game. This is my vacation. We found a spot on the grass by the pool & it worked for us. This is most annoying because 90% of the chairs reserved with a towel remained empty most of the day. We only did one outside trip & spent every day by the pool, so this is not exaggerated.

reviews.title: Nice Resort w/ beautiful grounds, and fab. food
reviews.text: The Ugly: guests from other countries that is, NOT the Dominican people, they were lovely. I will not mention a country of origin, but I have never seen such arrogant, ill-mannered, down right rude behavior in my life. They would physically push you out of their way, cut the buffet line (What line?, What's a line? because they sure as heck don't know), grab serving untensils from your hand when you weren't done (this happened to my husband, no kidding), would not even look at you or acknowledge your presence if you didn't speak their language. I have traveled extensively to almost every caribbean island and have never experienced such rude behavior in my life! The unfortunate part of the Natura staff was by waiting on them first, even though they obviously cut in front of you, only helped validate that their rude behavior was acceptable, or maybe it was just the norm.

description: Welcome to Natura Park Beach Eco Resort & SpaExperience a holiday in complete harmony with nature at our luxury Punta Cana resort, Blau Natura Park. Lush tropical gardens teeming with exotic bird life are interspersed with lagoons and bridges along winding paths which lead to the beach. Our Punta Cana luxury hotel is located on the marvelous Playa Bavaro beach, one of the best in the Caribbean.
